title: Coffee Plant Health and Disease Management

questions.question: What is the scientific name of the fungus that causes coffee leaf rust?
Which of the following is NOT a symptom of coffee leaf rust?
choices: Orange-yellow powdery spots on the underside of leaves
Yellowish spots on the upper leaf surface
Leaves turning brown and falling off
White, cottony growth on coffee cherries
questions.answer: White, cottony growth on coffee cherries

questions.question: What is the optimal temperature range for coffee leaf rust development?
Which insect pest is considered the most harmful in coffee production?
What is the scientific name of the coffee berry borer?
Which part of the coffee plant does the coffee berry borer primarily damage?
What is the typical size range of an adult coffee berry borer?
Which of the following is NOT a principle of Integrated Pest Management (IPM)?
What is the primary goal of cultural control methods in IPM?
choices: To make the environment less favorable for pests
questions.answer: To make the environment less favorable for pests

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of biological control in coffee production?
What is the recommended approach for chemical control in IPM strategies?
choices: Use as the primary method of pest control

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a benefit of organic pest control methods?
Which local material is commonly used in organic pesticide preparations for coffee plants?
What is the purpose of adding soap to homemade organic pesticide sprays?
How often should a neem-based organic spray typically be applied to coffee plants?
What is the primary function of regular field scouting in coffee plant health management?
choices: To monitor for pests and diseases
questions.answer: To monitor for pests and diseases

questions.question: Which environmental factor exacerbates coffee leaf rust problems?
What is the potential yield loss in coffee production due to severe coffee leaf rust infestation?
Which stage of the coffee berry borer's life cycle causes the most damage to coffee beans?
What is a potential long-term consequence of repeated chemical pesticide use in coffee production?
Which of the following is an example of a cultural control method for managing coffee berry borer?
choices: Regular harvesting to remove potential host material
questions.answer: Regular harvesting to remove potential host material

questions.question: What is the primary mode of spread for coffee leaf rust spores?
Which part of the coffee plant does the coffee leaf rust fungus initially infect?
What is the recommended humidity level for optimal coffee leaf rust development?
Which gender of the coffee berry borer causes the most damage to coffee cherries?
What is a potential benefit of implementing IPM strategies in coffee production?
choices: Minimized economic, health, and environmental risks
questions.answer: Minimized economic, health, and environmental risks

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a component of Integrated Pest Management?
choices: Exclusive reliance on one control method
questions.answer: Exclusive reliance on one control method

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of pruning in coffee plant health management?
Which of the following organisms is used as a biological control agent for coffee berry borer?
What is the main advantage of using organic pesticides in coffee production?
choices: They are more potent than synthetic pesticides
They have a lower environmental impact
They are always cheaper than synthetic alternatives
They provide complete eradication of all pests
questions.answer: They have a lower environmental impact
